column4: how can i grab files on a windows-pc where a username and password is needed? does the windows-pc have to add me as user?
try entering garbage first
where?
for the username and password, try entering anything
if that doesn't work, try admin and the password
try the command line client - smbclient //WINDOWSPC/SHARE
at the moment the windows-pc is not on line
In order to access the share you will need to have it on
are you trying to mount something for a dual boot machine?
no, the windows-machine has "given free" some files, which i want to see and load onto my pc
ok, give the commandline client a shot, and see if that works. smb browsing under nautilus is sometimes borked
try to use the cli version to test to see if you can get to the machine
so "smbclient //windowspcname/dir/" will show me the files, right?
it should, if it doesn't try -u and add a username and it should prompt for the password
how does a network works? why do i need samba for windows-networks? is it a protokoll? can i also build up a pure linux-network with samba? what is the advantage?
samba is for accessing ServerMessageBlock systems, a windows protocol for passing files between systems
that is what windows shares talk to each other
and what does linux use?
A variety of systems. The most common is NFS or Network File System
one more question please ;) .... how can i serve files and printers (with ubuntu)
that is going beyond what I can tell you easily. Google samba file and printer sharing. There are some good docs out there
thanks very much! cu
